criteria: Ability to Compute Unit Rates with Fractions
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of unit rate as a ratio between two quantities.
Student shows limited understanding of unit rate, struggling to define it or explain its purpose.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of unit rate but has difficulty applying it in problem-solving.
Student understands the concept of unit rate and can apply it to simple problems.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of unit rate and can accurately calculate it in most scenarios.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of unit rate, accurately calculates it, and explains its significance in various contexts.
Student is unable to perform any calculations involving ratios of fractions to find unit rates.
Student attempts to calculate unit rates with fractions but makes significant errors in the process.
Student can perform some calculations with fractions but struggles to accurately compute the unit rate.
Student can compute unit rates with fractions in straightforward problems but may struggle with more complex scenarios.
Student consistently and accurately computes unit rates with fractions, showing proficiency in the required calculations.
Student demonstrates mastery in computing unit rates with complex fractions and can clearly explain each step in the process.
Student cannot apply the concept of unit rates to any real-world scenarios.
Student struggles to relate unit rates to real-world problems and cannot set up appropriate calculations.
Student can identify real-world situations involving unit rates but has difficulty setting up and solving the problem.
Student can apply unit rates to solve simple real-world problems, but may struggle with multi-step problems.
Student can effectively use unit rates to solve a variety of real-world problems with accuracy.
Student demonstrates a sophisticated ability to apply unit rates to complex real-world problems, providing clear and accurate solutions.
Student shows no understanding of how to work with different units when calculating unit rates.
Student struggles to convert or reconcile different units when computing unit rates.
Student can sometimes work with different units but makes errors in conversion or application.
Student generally understands how to handle different units when calculating unit rates, but may need some assistance.
Student demonstrates competency in working with different units to accurately calculate unit rates.
Student expertly manipulates different units to compute unit rates and provides clear explanations of unit conversions.
